definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: The doctrine of the meaninglessness of contradictions runs away back.
sentences.chinese: 這種關於矛盾是無意義的教條早已有之。

sentences.english: That’s bound to lead to new movements that emphasize self-transcendence but put little stock in divine law or revelation.
sentences.chinese: 這必然導致強調自我超越但忽視教條和啓示的新動向。

sentences.english: Legalism destroys our loving relationship with God.
sentences.chinese: 教條主義毀滅我們與上帝之間的愛。

sentences.english: I am also opposed to the indoctrination of children in monasteries .
sentences.chinese: 我也反對以教條式的兒童在寺院中。

sentences.english: For starters, you might see people acting more dogmatic than usual.
sentences.chinese: 首先，你會看到，人們的行爲非常教條。

sentences.english: However, He catches obvious dogmatism and often neglects the creative experience.
sentences.chinese: 一個染上明顯的教條主義，常常“忘記”創作經驗。

sentences.english: That means they are not doctrinaire.
sentences.chinese: 那意味着，他們並不教條。

sentences.english: Nanrong Chu couldn't understand completely the dogmatic instruction.
sentences.chinese: 南榮趎對這樣教條式的說法還是不能完全領會。

sentences.english: This is one piece of dogmatism that a scientist can allow himself.
sentences.chinese: 這一條教條定論是一個科學家能夠任憑他自己接受的。

sentences.english: Where it can reflect upon its dogmatic wanderings.
sentences.chinese: 懷疑讓理性能反省其教條式的漫遊旅程。

sentences.english: Paradoxically though, their thought might harden into ‘religions’ with rigid new dogmas?
sentences.chinese: 他們可能荒謬地認爲，宗教就是僵化的教條。

sentences.english: New dogmas are much worse that old ones.
sentences.chinese: 新的教條遠較舊的教條更爲有害。

sentences.english: New dogmas are much worse that old ones.
sentences.chinese: 新的教條遠較舊的教條更爲有害。

sentences.english: Certainly she did not raise me with any dogma except the dogma of science.
sentences.chinese: 當然，她教我除了科學之外別無其他教條。

sentences.english: He is extremely critical of dogmatism of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 他是非常關鍵的任何形式的教條主義。

sentences.english: One is the defiant reaffirmation of dogma .
sentences.chinese: 一個是對教條不顧一切地重新肯定。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
